abstract: The credit card company is said to be in talks to buy Visa Europe for as much as $20 billion. A deal would bring global dominance and cost savings.
snippet: The credit card company is said to be in talks to buy Visa Europe for as much as $20 billion. A deal would bring global dominance and cost savings.
lead_paragraph: It’s a good time for Visa to charge up overseas. Buying its former subsidiary Visa Europe may cost the American payments company as much as $20 billion. There are plenty of reasons to act now.

headline.main: A Good Time for Visa to Take Europe
